meanings.definition: Make (something) neat or of the required size or form by cutting away irregular or unwanted parts.
meanings.sent1: She used scissors to trim the paper edges neatly.
meanings.sent2: The barber will trim your hair to make it look tidy.
meanings.sent3: He tried to trim the bush into the shape of a heart, but it ended up looking like a blob.
meanings.sent4: She trimmed the excess fabric like a sculptor shaping a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully trimmed the hedge to create a perfect square shape.

meanings.definition: Decorate (something) by adding a finishing touch or ornament.
meanings.sent1: They will trim the Christmas tree with colorful lights and ornaments.
meanings.sent2: She likes to trim her cakes with edible flowers for a beautiful presentation.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to trim their sandcastle with seashells and seaweed.
meanings.sent4: The artist trimmed the painting with gold leaf to add a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: He carefully trimmed the gift box with a satin ribbon for a lovely finish.

meanings.definition: Adjust (a sail) to take advantage of the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailor needs to trim the sail to catch the wind properly.
meanings.sent2: They will trim the sail to ensure the boat moves smoothly through the water.
meanings.sent3: As the wind picked up, he had to trim the sail quickly to avoid tipping over.
meanings.sent4: She expertly trimmed the sail, guiding the boat with precision.
meanings.sent5: The captain knew exactly when to trim the sail for maximum speed.
